name: Pope Bl. Victor III
summary: Victor III, born Desiderius, was Pope from 1086 to 1087. Before becoming pope, he was the abbot of Monte Cassino, one of the most important Benedictine monasteries. He was a close friend and supporter of Gregory VII and continued his reform efforts. His papacy was short but significant, as he worked to maintain the Gregorian Reforms during a difficult period. He is venerated as Blessed.
